results.title: The Pressure of light
results.brief_description: Light pressure on a thin foil suspended in high vacuum sets the foil into oscillation. It leads up to this by a discussion of the Crookes radiometer and the effect - not light pressure - that causes it to rotate. The role of light pressure in the universe is also briefly discussed.

results.title: Presenting South Australia. No. 4
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Shepherd and South Australian Government Tourist Bureau
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Art in the open: a survey of the Open Air Art Exhibitions held annually in various parks around Adelaide. Historic residence in the hills: eight miles from Adelaide at the Bellair National Park is the Old Government House. Down at the wharf: a boy spends a pleasant Sunday afternoon at Port Adelaide.

results.title: Powerlines for electricity
results.brief_description: Cable making industry in Australia. From the raw materials of copper , lead , aluminium, rubber and plastic we follow the process to the finished products. Shows the light flexible cable for domestic use as telephone and ironing cords; and heavy cables used in elevators, and mobile cranes; finishes with the making and laying of the co-axial cable which now links the telecommunications systems between Melbourne, Canberra and Sydney.
results.description: Cable making industry in Australia. From the raw materials of copper , lead , aluminium, rubber and plastic we follow the process to the finished products. results.title: Power for Uganda
results.creator_credit: W. Hugh Baddeley and Gateway Film Productions
results.brief_description: Records the planning, construction, and opening of the Owen Falls hydro-electric station near the source of the Nile River. A model is used to explain the purpose of the various dams. Stresses the importance of the dam to Uganda, for as well as harnessing power for industry it will provide an adequate year-round supply of water.

results.title: Poultry a billion dollar industry
results.brief_description: Winner of the first prize at the International Exposition of Agricultural Films held in Rome in May, 1940, this film is a study of American poultry-farming, showing in detail its organization, its methods of marketing and its importance in the national economy of USA.

results.title: Posture and exercise
results.brief_description: This film explains muscle action, and the physiology of exercise. Concepts presented include the relation of the nervous system to the skeletal muscles, motor units of work, development of endurance, muscle tonus in relation to posture, and peripheral circulation as it is related to physical efficiency.
